meanings.def: the particular quality that different foods and drinks have that allows you to recognize them when you put them in your mouth
examples: a sweet/salty/bitter/sour taste
I don't like the taste of olives.
This dish has an unusual combination of tastes and textures.
The soup has very little taste.
Don't have a cigarette now—you'll spoil the taste of your food!
He sensed the taste of blood in his mouth.
I had a strong coffee to take away the nasty taste of the food.
She savoured the taste of the champagne.
The drink left a bitter taste in his mouth.
You need to use fresh herbs to get the authentic Italian taste.

meanings.def: the sense you have that allows you to recognize different foods and drinks when you put them in your mouth
examples: I've lost my sense of taste.

meanings.def: a small quantity of food or drink that you try in order to see what it is like
examples: Just have a taste of this cheese.
Do you want a taste?
This was my first taste of live theatre.
Although we didn't know it, this incident was a taste of things to come.

meanings.def: a person’s ability to choose things that people recognize as being of good quality or appropriate
examples: taste in something He has very good taste in music.
They've got more money than taste.
She's famous for her impeccable taste and style.
The room was furnished with taste.
The remark showed a deplorable lack of taste.
The designer has exercised good taste in her choice of fabrics.
Her work is executed with impeccable taste.
Contemporary arbiters of taste dismissed his paintings as rubbish.

meanings.def: what a person likes or prefers
examples: You can adapt the recipe to suit your personal taste.
taste for something That trip gave me a taste for foreign travel.
to develop/acquire a taste for luxury
taste in something He has very expensive taste in clothes.
The colour and style is a matter of personal taste
to somebody's taste Modern art is not to everyone's taste.
There are trips to suit all tastes.
They have a taste for adventure.
Her choice of outfit demonstrated her taste for the outrageous.
Now he is retired he has time to indulge his tastes for writing and politics.
People with a taste for complex plots will enjoy this book.
Her music appeals to popular taste.
His tastes run to the exotic.
If fishing is not to your taste, there are many other leisure activities on offer.
The house reflected his tastes.
The music was too modern for my taste.
You obviously share her taste in reading.
He has an unusual taste in music.

meanings.def: a thing that you do not like much at first but gradually learn to like
examples: Abstract art is an acquired taste.

meanings.def: to be offensive and not at all appropriate
examples: Most of his jokes were in very poor taste.

meanings.def: to be appropriate and not at all offensive
examples: The love scenes are all done in the best possible taste.

meanings.def: to make you feel upset or ashamed afterwards
examples: The whole business left a bad taste in my mouth.

meanings.def: the same bad treatment that you have given to others
examples: Let the bully have a taste of his own medicine.

meanings.def: used to say how difficult it is to understand why somebody likes somebody/something that you do not like at all
examples: She thinks he's wonderful—oh well, there's no accounting for taste.

meanings.def: in the quantity that is needed to make something taste the way you prefer
examples: Add salt and pepper to taste.

idioms.def: a thing that you do not like much at first but gradually learn to like
examples: Abstract art is an acquired taste.

idioms.idiom: be in good, the best possible, etc. taste

idioms.idiom: leave a bad/nasty taste in the mouth

idioms.def: used to say how difficult it is to understand why somebody likes somebody/something that you do not like at all
examples: She thinks he's wonderful—oh well, there's no accounting for taste.

related: a taste/dose of your own medicine
leave a bad/nasty taste in the mouth
be, feel, look, taste, etc. like nothing on earth

examples: + adj. to taste good/delicious/sweet
taste like something This drink tastes like sherry.
taste of something The ice tasted of mint.
Why are you wanting a new phone when your current one works perfectly well?
What shall we do tonight? I’m thinking bowling.
I’m loving the weather today!
The fish tasted faintly of garlic.
The water tasted strongly of chemicals.
The fruit tasted rather like mango.
foul-tasting medicine

meanings.def: to be able to recognize tastes in food and drink
examples: You can taste the garlic in this stew.
I can't really taste anything with this cold.

meanings.def: to test the taste of something by eating or drinking a small amount of it
examples: Taste it and see if you think there's enough salt in it.
Would you like to taste the wine?

meanings.def: to eat or drink food or liquid
examples: That's the best ice cream I've ever tasted.
I've never tasted anything like it.
I haven't tasted meat since I started the journey.

meanings.def: to have a short experience of something, especially something that you want more of
examples: He had tasted freedom only to lose it again.
